intro: Pentanema kurdistanicum, commonly known as Kurdish pentanema, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Kurdistan. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, adapted to thrive in high-altitude environments. It is often found in rocky and well-drained soils, growing in open meadows and forest edges. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
